alert.note: Alert for Western Chelan County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 06 at 3:03PM PST until January 10 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST SUNDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, additional snow accumulations up to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 4 feet possible, with higher amounts at the Cascade Crest. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Stevens Pass, Stehekin, and Holden Village. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 4 AM PST Sunday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Sunday night through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...The strong winds and weight of snow on tree limbs may down power lines and could cause sporadic power outages. Travel could be very difficult to impossible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates up to an inch per hour will likely occur at Stevens Pass between midnight and sunrise on Saturday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest travel information in Washington, go to https://wsdot.wa.gov/travel Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
